title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 65 (Racism 4)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 65 (Racism 4):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Aaronson - From Slave Abuse to Hate Crime; the Criminalization of Racial Violence in American History (2014)

-  Archer - Higher Education and Social Class; Issues of Exclusion and Inclusion (2003)

-  Back & Solomos (Eds.) - Theories of Race and Racism; a Reader (2000)

-  Beasley - The Victorian Reinvention of Race; New Racisms and the Problem of Grouping in the Human Sciences (2010)

-  Brown - White-Washing Race; the Myth of a Color-Blind Society (2003)

-  Carbado & Gulati - Acting White; Rethinking Race in Post-Racial America (2013)

-  Dattel - Cotton and Race in the Making of America; the Human Costs of Economic Power (2009)

-  FitzGerald & Cook-Martin - Culling the Masses; the Democratic Origins of Racist Immigration Policy in the Americas (2014)

-  Forbes & Stampton - The White Nationalist Skinhead Movement, UK & USA, 1979-1993 (2015)

-  Glaude - Democracy in Black; How Race Still Enslaves the American Soul (2016)

-  Gordon-Reed - Race on Trial; Law and Justice in American History (2002)

-  Hobbs - Democracy Abroad, Lynching at Home; Racial Violence in Florida (2015)

-  Katznelson - When Affirmative Action was White; an Untold History of Racial Inequality in 20th-Century America (2005)

-  Keevak - Becoming Yellow; a Short History of Racial Thinking (2011)

-  Lebron - The Color of Our Shame; Race and Justice in Our Time (2013)

-  Madigan - The Burning; Massacre, Destruction, and the Tulsa Race Riot of 1921 (2001)

-  Mama - Beyond the Masks; Race, Gender and Subjectivity (1995)

-  Mixon - The Atlanta Riot; Race, Class, and Violence in a New South City (2005)

-  Palidda (Ed.) - Racial Criminalization of Migrants in the 21st Century (2011)

-  Ramey - Black Legacies; Race and the European Middle Ages (2014)

-  Rich - Wrong Place, Wrong Time; Trauma and Violence in the Lives of Young Black Men (2009)

-  Rocchio - Reel Racism; Confronting Hollywood's Construction of Afro-American Culture (2000)

-  Rosenblatt - The Impact of Racism on African American Families; Literature as Social Science (2014)

-  Simi & Futrell - American Swastika; Inside the White Power Movements Hidden Spaces of Hate, 2e (2015)

-  Smith - How Race Is Made; Slavery, Segregation, and the Senses (2006)

-  Smith - Race and Rhetoric in the Renaissance; Barbarian Errors (2009)

-  Thurston - Lynching; American Mob Murder in Global Perspective (2011)

-  Waldrep - African American Confronts Lynching (2009)

-  Waldrep - The Many Faces of Judge Lynch; Extralegal Violence and Punishment in America (2002)

-  Wallis - America's Original Sin; Racism, White Privilege, and the Bridge to a New America (2016)

-  Warren - Who Speaks for the Negro (1965)

-  Watson - Freedom Summer; the Savage Season That Made Mississippi Burn and Made America a Democracy (2010)

-  Wilson - Specters of Democracy; Blackness and the Aesthetics of Politics in the Antebellum U.S. (2011)

-  Wise - White Like Me; Reflections on Race from a Privileged Son (2011)

-  Wright - Racial Violence in Kentucky, 1865-1940; Lynchings, Mob Rule, and 'Legal Lynchings' (1990)
